intro: Berlandiera lyrata var. macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf beargrass, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has basal leaves that are large, heart-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. This variety is closely related to other members of the Malvaceae family, sharing similar structural and floral features.
